content.description: This route follows scattered and somewhat discontinuous crack systems over a featured face. The gear placements are not necessarily beginner friendly and can be somewhat tricky.
content.protection: Standard rack , 2 bolt anchor at top.
content.location: Just to the right of Dinosaur Omelet is a heavily featured face with scatted cracks and fissures the general left side of this face below the routes finishing anchor is the line.

content.description: This route runs though a swath or cracks towards a two bolt anchor. While the climbing is mellow the gear placements can be tricky and not overly beginner friendly.
content.protection: Standard rack , Two bolt anchor at top.
content.location: Just to the left of Scrambled Salami is a face heavily featured with many meandering crack systems the route runs up the general right side of this face toward a two bolt anchor.

content.description: Face-climb to a horizontal crack to place gear until you get to a long sloping-up-and-right ledge. Up a little more to a steep bulge with a right facing crack. Go over the bulge by first heading up a move on the left (layback). After the bulge, face-climb a short distance to a small ledge, then head up a crack system. When you are a few feet below the top, traverse left over a mini staircase-like spot to the anchor.
content.protection: Small gear up to two inches. 2 bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Left-of-middle of Scrambler's Wall--up a short sandstone ramp and starting to the right of a scrub oak. There is an easy walk-off.

content.description: There are three main cracks on this wall. Green Eggs and Ham is the right-most one. Follow the vertical crack to begin with, then climb through a run-out section to a left-facing dihedral. Some loose rock, so step carefully.
content.protection: Standard to 3". Trad anchor if you follow the crack, or a bolted anchor to the left of the climb up top.
content.location: Walk-off to the climber's left. 10 minutes.

content.description: The crux of this route is above the chimney where it gets flat.
content.protection: The size of the protection is .75 to 5 inches. At the top there are bolted anchors.
content.location: The route is about 50 feet to the left of Scrambled Salami and it starts with a chimney that is about 1 foot wide. There is a walk-off that leads down to a trail that takes you back to the base climb.

content.description: A "stiff" beginning gives way to much more mild climbing about half way up the route just past a large ledge/ramp.
content.protection: Standard Rack to a #3 , Two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: This route is located in the some what slabby middle area between the crack systems/corners that make up Scrambled Salami and Green Eggs and Ham.

content.description: The Scramblers wall area is a crag featuring a variety of low-grade trad routes. A bit run-out with some loose rock the routes found here can be somewhat forgettable. However the mellow nature and ability to access the anchors without leading the routes can offer a pleasant afternoon for new trad leaders to cut their teeth.
